Sentencas: The sulfur resistance and performance of Sr- and Mn-doped yttrium chromite (YSCM)-samaria-doped ceria (SDC) composite material were investigated for potential use as anodes in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel

Sentencas: The anode was well adhered to the electrolyte, which was ascribed to their similar coefficient of thermal expansion (TEC).
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel

Sentencas: The electro-catalytic activity of YSCM-SDC anodes in yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte-supported cells toward hydrogen oxidation was superior to that of the La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-delta (LSCM) anode.
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel

Sentencas: Sr depletion in the YSCM structure and the formation of SrSO4 in the presence of sulfur led to performance degradation of the anode.
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel

Sentencas: Irreversible and reversible performance degradation suggested that YSCM and SDC played a respective role during the anode deactivation process.
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel

Sentencas: The voltage decreased at a rate of 31 mV/h and stabilized at 0.49 V under a 3000 ppm H2S atmosphere.
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel

Sentencas: In addition, the sulfur tolerance of YSCM-SDC anode was better than SDC under strictly identical conditions.
Titulo: Performance and sulfur resistance of doped yttrium chromite-ceria composite as anode material for the SOFCs operating on H2S-containing fuel
